full_text:
So many people came to
the first exhibition that they
were all out in the street.
They couldn't even get on the
elevator to get up. And if you
got up, you couldn't get down
because it was just full of
people. There was nowhere
to go. I'm surprised that they
didn't call the fire department
and make everybody leave.
Gylbert Coker, JAM volunteer, art historian, and curator
JAM was an experimental
alternative space where
anything went. You could do
anything if you could figure
out how to do it.
Kathleen Goncharov, JAM curator and artist
